summary: Lance W. Svendsen was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). He is listed in multiple payroll certification reports from 1978 and 1979, indicating his employment during that period. The documents provide details such as his name, social security number, position, salary, and employment dates within the SCA. These payroll records confirm his role as a staff member during the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Lance W. Svendsen's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his role isn't detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll indicates his involvement in the committee's operations during a crucial period of its investigation.
